Articles.Content: YAAAAAAY!!!! Raidernick is back!!!
Sweet!
HARRR HARRR TO RAIDERNICK!
Great to have you back in business!

Wow super amazing work soyuz 7-k looks exactly like the real one thank!

Now please ad the soyuz TMA.

5 hours ago, Curiosity7907 said:

Wow super amazing work soyuz 7-k looks exactly like the real one thank!

Now please ad the soyuz TMA.

Uh oh.  Let me translate this for you, Raider:

Are the Soyuz T models on your to-do list for the future?  I would enjoy seeing your version of the TMA in KSP!

And to add on to that, I'd like to see your own version of MIR as well.  I'm enjoying your soviet stuff so far!  Keep up the excellent work, Comrade!

Anyway, Curiosity7907, Raidernick is currently working on US rockets

Edited February 23, 2016 by Deltac
Clarification
Do you plan on doing your own R-7 variants and N1?

3 hours ago, Deltac said:

Uh oh.  Let me translate this for you, Raider:

Are the Soyuz T models on your to-do list for the future?  I would enjoy seeing your version of the TMA in KSP!

And to add on to that, I'd like to see your own version of MIR as well.  I'm enjoying your soviet stuff so far!  Keep up the excellent work, Comrade!

Anyway, Curiosity7907, Raidernick is currently working on US rockets

I have no plans to do MIR or TMA. I don't like doing things that are already done and still fully functional in KSP. Also, there are too many people working on russian stuff right now so I'm taking a break from it to work on old us stuff instead.

19 hours ago, raidernick said:

I have no plans to do MIR or TMA. I don't like doing things that are already done and still fully functional in KSP. Also, there are too many people working on russian stuff right now so I'm taking a break from it to work on old us stuff instead.

Well, Bobcat's mods are pretty much dead, save for the Mir that Decq is refurbishing, but it's not to scale with your stuff and could use a remodeling.  Tantares is going stock-a-like, and their soyuz can only carry 2 Kerbals.  If anything, it seems we have a lack of soviet projects at the moment.  But yeah, if you don't want to do TMA and Mir, that's cool.  Would rather you have passion for what you're doing than just going through the motions

UPDATE v2.2

**Changelog:**

* Fix uda and va capsule
* Fix rcs on some parts
* Remove broken craft files because of new rockets update, they will be fixed in the future

https://github.com/KSP-RO/SalyutStations-SoyuzFerries/releases/tag/v2.2

I'll tell you more, I have my own model of Soyuz TMA.
You should add the Soyuz launch clamps. That would be awesome!

4 hours ago, Battledamaged10 said:

You should add the Soyuz launch clamps. That would be awesome!

I made those years ago and never finished or released them. I may do it if I have the time/drive to do it.

I am currently working on redoing all the Vostok/Voskhod/LOK/LK parts to fix the long standing lag issues. So far I have been experimenting with the Vostok service module. I have gotten the file size from 58mb to 38mb for a 20mb savings. If this works out well enough I may do it to all of my parts in every pack. Besides making all of the parts smaller and less laggy, it also makes the shading smoother so they look better in game with no performance hit.

I was able to make the vostok another 12mb smaller, it is at 26mb now. This new "low poly" version looks almost as good as the original with little to no lag that the original caused. Also I redid the voskhod airlock texture to not suck anymore.

UPDATE v2.3

Changelog:

  • Split Soyuz pack into it's own separate pack, this mod now only contains Salyut/Almaz parts

https://github.com/KSP-RO/SalyutStations/releases/tag/v2.3

 

New Soyuz Thread:

 

Edited March 6, 2016 by raidernick

UPDATE v.2.3.5

Changelog:

  • Merged dependency, old craft files won't work

https://github.com/KSP-RO/SalyutStations/releases/tag/v2.3.5

Edited March 7, 2016 by raidernick

//USI Life Support to Salyut 1, 4, 6 and 7
@PART[almaz3-5,salyut1-4,salyut6,salyut7]:NEEDS[USILifeSupport]
{
	-RESOURCE[Food]{}
	-RESOURCE[Water]{}
	-RESOURCE[Oxygen]{}
	-RESOURCE[CarbonDioxide]{}
	-RESOURCE[Waste]{}
	-RESOURCE[WasteWater]{}

	%RESOURCE[Supplies]
	{
		%amount = 0
		%maxAmount = 3000
	}

	%RESOURCE[Mulch]
	{
		%amount = 0
		%maxAmount = 3000
	}
}

In case anyone plays with USI Life Support instead of TAC, this little MM .cfg removes the TAC resources and adds mulch/supplies. Change values to personal preference.

This is my first module manager patch I wrote, so feel free to point out suggestions/errors.

Edited March 18, 2016 by hendrack

.

Edited March 28, 2016 by agov261
are you gonna make it catible with 1.1 ? i have glitch there , the engines stage as normal , but they don't activate so they aren't consuming fuel , and i don't like that .

57 minutes ago, woo_reentry_is_cool_dude said:

are you gonna make it catible with 1.1 ? i have glitch there , the engines stage as normal , but they don't activate so they aren't consuming fuel , and i don't like that .

Yes I will update to 1.1 but that has nothing to do with a compatibility issue. It's a problem with how CKAN installs mods, you'll need to install the mods manually to fix it. If you aren't using ckan I can't help you as you just did it wrong.

UPDATE v2.4

  • Remove the old version completely including ALL MM CFG FILES before installing this! This means also remove any RN_.cfg files in the main gamedata folder!

  • Update for KSP 1.1.2

  • Update dependencies
  • Switched to texture replacer for reflections since reflection plugin is not being updated
  • Update configs
  • Add new WORKING craft files

https://github.com/KSP-RO/SalyutStations/releases/tag/v2.4

Edited May 2, 2016 by raidernick
Thank you VERY much for the update! The time you spend on these is much appreciated.

Just a bit of feedback on what looks like a small file name problem. I was getting an error on Salyut 4 & 6 saying I was missing part: "Kosmos.TKS.Solar.Array.rn2". After some looking around I discovered Kosmos_TKS_Solar_Array_rn2.cfg and Kosmos_TKS_Solar_Array_rn2.cfg. I renamed the files, as well as the two references in the cfg file and it fixed it.
I don't know what you are talking about the craft files load just fine. I just downloaded the latest zip and put on a new game and it works perfectly fine.
